title: User Registration Success
description: Verify that a user can register successfully with valid email and password, resulting in password hashing and user creation.

steps.description: Navigate to the registration page.
Input a valid email address and a strong password.
Submit the registration form.
Verify the user is created in the database with password hashed.
Verify a success message or redirect to login occurs.

title: User Registration Failure with Invalid Email
description: Verify that registration fails when the email format is invalid, and an appropriate error message is provided.

steps.description: Navigate to the registration page.
Input an invalid email format and a valid password.
Submit the registration form.
Verify registration is rejected with a validation error stating invalid email.

title: User Login Success with Correct Credentials
description: Verify user login success flow using valid email and password and receipt of JWT token and session management.

steps.description: Navigate to the login page.
Enter registered email and correct password.
Submit the login form.
Verify login is successful and JWT token is issued.
Verify user session is established and protected routes are accessible.

title: User Login Failure with Incorrect Credentials
description: Verify login failure when using incorrect password and appropriate error message returned without issuing tokens.

steps.description: Navigate to the login page.
Enter registered email and incorrect password.
Submit the login form.
Verify login is rejected with unauthorized error and no token issued.

title: User Logout Invalidates Session
description: Verify that logout invalidates user's session and prevents access to protected resources afterwards.

steps.description: Login successfully and obtain a session.
Send logout request to the API.
Verify the session is invalidated on backend.
Attempt to access protected API endpoints.
Verify access is denied due to missing or invalid session.

title: Match Creation with Valid Data
description: Verify that authenticated users can successfully create a cricket match with valid data including teams, players, overs, venue, and start time.

steps.description: Login and navigate to match creation page.
Input valid teams, player rosters, number of overs, venue, and scheduled start time.
Submit the match creation form.
Verify match is created in database with correct details.
Verify successful response and UI confirmation.

title: Match Creation Failure with Invalid Data
description: Verify match creation is rejected when invalid or incomplete data is submitted and proper validation error messages are returned.

steps.description: Login and navigate to match creation page.
Input invalid or missing required fields (e.g. no players, overs=0).
Submit the match creation form.
Verify backend validation rejects the request with HTTP 400 and clear error messages.

title: Starting a Match with Toss and Player Selection
description: Verify authorized users can start a match by conducting a toss and selecting opening batsmen and opening bowler, transitioning match state appropriately.

steps.description: Login and retrieve a created match that is in setup state.
Conduct toss via API or interface, selecting toss winner and choice.
Select opening batsmen and bowler from team rosters.
Send request to start the match.
Verify match state updates to 'in progress'.
Verify the selected players are assigned as striker, non-striker, and bowler.

title: Live Scoring - Normal Ball Outcome Entry
description: Verify live scoring interface accepts valid ball-by-ball inputs for runs, extras, wickets with correct validation and updates scores correctly.

steps.description: Open live scoring interface for an ongoing match.
Select striker, non-striker, and bowler.
Record a legal delivery with runs scored (0 to 6) without extras or wickets.
Verify runs added to score, ball counted properly, and strike rotated if applicable.
Verify UI and data reflect updated over and innings state.

title: Live Scoring - Extras and Wickets Validation
description: Verify live scoring detects and prevents invalid extras and wicket scenarios such as consecutive overs by same bowler, improper ball counts, and wrong wicket types.

steps.description: Attempt to record a delivery with an illegal extra type or invalid runs for that extra.
Verify validation error is shown and ball is not recorded.
Attempt to bowl consecutive overs by the same bowler.
Verify bowling restriction validation prevents this.
Attempt to record incorrect balls counting wides and no-balls affecting over count.
Verify ball counting logic excludes wides/no-balls correctly.

title: Real-time Updates Broadcast via Pusher
description: Verify that live scoring actions trigger real-time updates broadcasting to all connected clients with latency under 500ms.

steps.description: Connect multiple clients/viewers to a live match page.
Record a scoring event on the live scoring interface.
Verify all connected clients receive updated match data within 500ms.
Verify UI updates reflect new runs, overs, wickets, and player stats in real-time.

title: Protected Routes Enforce Authentication and Authorization
description: Verify that API endpoints and pages requiring authentication reject unauthorized access with proper HTTP status codes.

steps.description: Attempt to access protected API endpoints like match creation, scoring, and user dashboard without authentication.
Verify server responds with HTTP 401 Unauthorized or 403 Forbidden.
Attempt to perform actions on matches user is not authorized to manage.
Verify authorization checks prevent access and return appropriate errors.

title: Data Input Sanitization on Backend
description: Verify that all user inputs including registration, match creation, and scoring data are sanitized and validated server-side to prevent injections and malformed data.

steps.description: Submit inputs containing potential injection code (e.g. scripts, special characters) in registration, match, and scoring APIs.
Verify backend rejects or sanitizes inputs without compromising data integrity or security.
Verify no database or application errors occur and no injection attacks succeed.

title: Performance of Scoring Actions under Load
description: Verify that scoring actions API responds within 150ms at median latency with concurrent users scoring at typical load levels.

steps.description: Simulate concurrent scoring API requests at expected match throughput (ball-by-ball recording).
Measure API response times and verify 50th percentile is under 150ms.

title: Scorecard Display Accuracy and Completeness
description: Verify the finalized scorecard view correctly shows ball-by-ball details, individual player stats, innings information, and match summary after match completion.

steps.description: Complete a match including all overs and wickets.
Navigate to scorecard view page.
Verify that all balls are listed with runs, extras, wickets correctly annotated.
Verify player statistics such as runs, balls faced, strike rate, wickets taken match scoring data.
Verify innings total runs and extras are correctly aggregated.

title: Leaderboard Accuracy and Filtering
description: Verify leaderboard displays accurate aggregated team and player statistics with filtering and sorting as per requirements.

steps.description: Access the leaderboard page.
Verify team rankings are correctly computed from match results.
Verify player stats such as total runs, wickets, averages are correctly displayed.
Apply filtering or tab switches on leaderboard.
Verify data updates accordingly and remains consistent and accurate.

title: User Dashboard Data Display and Actions
description: Verify that user dashboard displays match overview, invited matches, and quick actions correctly for the logged-in user.

steps.description: Login as user with multiple current and invited matches.
Verify dashboard lists all matches user is participating in or invited to.
Verify quick actions like creating matches or joining are accessible and functional.

title: Landing Page Display and Call-to-Actions
description: Verify that landing page renders marketing content, features, live match previews, and call-to-actions correctly across supported browsers.

steps.description: Navigate to the home landing page.
Verify all marketing sections including Hero, Features, HowItWorks and LiveMatchPreview are present.
Verify call-to-action buttons function correctly including navigation to registration or login.

title: Accessibility Compliance for Scoring Controls
description: Verify that the scoring interface components meet WCAG AA guidelines for color contrast, keyboard navigation, and screen reader compatibility.

steps.description: Open the live scoring page.
Verify color contrast ratios meet WCAG AA standards.
Navigate scoring controls and inputs entirely using keyboard.
Verify all interactive elements are reachable, operable, and have visible focus states.
Use a screen reader to confirm meaningful labels and announcements on scoring controls.

title: API Returns Appropriate Status Codes and Error Messages
description: Verify all API endpoints return correct HTTP status codes and detailed error messages for validation failures, unauthorized access, and internal errors.

steps.description: Send requests with invalid data to various endpoints (auth, matches, scoring).
Verify responses contain HTTP 400 with relevant messages.
Access protected endpoints without auth.
Verify HTTP 401 or 403 is returned.
Simulate server errors (e.g. disconnect database).
Verify HTTP 500 responses with generic error messages.
